artifactCharge.damage: Plus an additional {formula} damage per additional artifact charge expended.
artifactCharge.healing: Plus an additional {formula} {healingType} per additional artifact charge expended.
artifactCharge.target: Plus an additional {formula} {targetType} per additional artifact charge expended.
artifactCharge.template: The {shape}'s {property} increases by {value} {unit} for every additional artifact charge expended.
artifactCharge.templateMulti: The {shape}'s {property} increases by {value} {unit} and its {property2} increases by {value2} {unit} for every additional artifact charge expended.

steppedArtifactCharge.damage: Plus an additional {formula} damage per additional {step} artifact charges expended.
steppedArtifactCharge.healing: Plus an additional {formula} {healingType} per additional {step} artifact charges expended.
steppedArtifactCharge.target: Plus an additional {formula} {targetType} per additional {step} artifact charges expended.

steppedArtifactCharge.templateMulti: The {shape}'s {property} increases by {value} {unit} and its {property2} increases by {value2} {unit} for every {step} additional artifact charges expended.

cantrip.templateMulti: The {shape}'s {property} increases by {value} {unit} and its {property2} increases by {value2} {unit} at 5th, 11th, and 17th level.

hints.5eStyleDeathSaves: When enabled, rolling a one on a Death Saving Throw incurs two failures. When disabled, the standard A5e rules are used (one failure and one point of Fatigue and Strife).
hints.5eStyleExpertise: When enabled, players will be able to select a two different tiers of proficiency for skills, as per the various 5e Expertise features.
hints.5eStyleJackOfAllTrades: When enabled, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.
hints.alwaysShowActionDescription: Always show the description of an action in the chat card regardless of the setting defined on the action.
hints.autoApplyFancySheets: When enabled, the system will automatically apply the fancy sheet to all possible compendiums. This requires all documents in the compendium to be of the same type.
hints.automateConditions: Automatically apply related effects for the selected conditions.
hints.automateBloodiedApplication: Enable automated application of the bloodied condition.
hints.automatePrototypeTokenSize: Enable the automatic setting of prototype token width and height on actor size change.
hints.automateUnconsciousApplication: Enable automated application of the unconscious and dead condition.
hints.automateVisionRules: Automatically apply vision rules to tokens when they are placed on the canvas.
hints.visionRulesApplyToCharactersOnly: Automatic application of vision rules will only be applied to characters.
hints.blindDeathSaves: When enabled, death saving rolls in chat cards and results on the actor will be hidden from players.
hints.cascadingDamageAndHealingDelay: When multiple damage and healing rolls are being applied in bulk, this value will set the delay between the start of one cascading value being displayed and the next. The value indicates a number of milliseconds.
hints.collapseActionList: When enabled, the action list will be hidden on locked sheets to reduce clutter. If an item has actions with uses, the actions will remain visible for that item.
hints.conditionFlowDirection: Setting this option to 'Row' causes the conditions to flow alphabetically left to right, row by row. Setting this option 'Column' causes the conditions to flow alphabetically top to bottom, column by column.
hints.critCalculationMode: Select the method of determining critical damage on a critical hit.
hints.diagonalRule: Configure the diagonal movement rule used.
hints.deathSaveThreshold: Set the death save roll threshold for automatic success or failure. Any roll result less than this threshold will be considered a failure.
hints.enableCascadingDamageAndHealing: When this setting is enabled, when an actor is damaged or healed, the value will briefly show above the affected token.
hints.enableDamageRollColors: When enabled, damage rolls in chat cards will be coloured according to their damage type.
hints.effectsPanelIconSize: Set the default size of the icons in the effects panel.
hints.effectsPanelPosition: Set the top, bottom, and right offset for the effects panel. The values are in pixels.
hints.enableRadialEffects: Change the default effects hud to display effects in a circle around the token.
hints.halflingLuck: When enabled d20 rolls resulting in a 1 will be automatically rerolled.
hints.hideA5eSkills: When enabled, the culture and engineering skills added in Level Up will be hidden on all sheets.
hints.hideActorCompendiumSelectionDialog: When enabled, the dialog to select a compendium when importing items for an actor will be hidden.
hints.hideBrokenAndDamaged: When enabled, the broken and damaged properties will be hidden from the item and item lists.
hints.hideChatDescriptionsByDefault: When this setting is enabled, the description sections of Item chat cards will be hidden by default. You can still reveal the description sections by clicking on the header of the chat card.
hints.hideDeletionConfirmationDialog: When this setting is enabled, you can delete items from actor sheets without being presented with a dialog window to confirm the deletion.
hints.hideExpertiseDice: When enabled, expertise dice will no longer be selectable in configuration windows and roll dialogs, and they will not be included in any roll formulae.
hints.hideRandomizedHPRolls: Hide the roll chat card for generating random NPC hit points.
hints.hideSkillCriticalPrompt: Hide the prompt button to roll on skill critical failure or success table.
hints.hideSkillSpecialties: When enabled, this will remove the ability to select skill specialties and will hide the skill specialties interface on the Actor skills tab.
hints.showVRCImplants: When enabled, this will show the current and max implants on actor sheets.
hints.showVRCProficiencies: When enabled, this will add the ability to select additional proficiencies specific to the Voidrunner's Codex.
hints.showVRCPsionicDisciplines: When enabled, this will add the Psionic Disciplines to Spells.
hints.showVRCSpecialties: When enabled, this will add the ability to select additional skill specialties specific to the Voidrunner's Codex.
hints.showVRCSkills: When enabled, this will add the Science skill to all sheets.
hints.showVRCTechLevel: When enabled, this will add the technology level to Objects.
hints.useCredits: When enabled, this will display Credits instead of Gold Pieces on all sheets.
hints.itemRightClickConfigure: Set the right click keybinding to configure an item instead of expanding it. This setting works even when the actor is in locked mode.
hints.jackOfAllTrades: When enabled, half of your proficiency bonus (rounded down) will be added to all skill and tool ability checks that do not already include your proficiency bonus.
hints.newActionNameType: Select the default name type for new actions. The System choice will use different names based on the type of the item document. The Action choice will always use the name 'New Action. The Item choice will always use the name of the item for the action name.
hints.placeItemTemplateDefault: Automatically select the 'Place Measured Template' option in the roll dialog for features, spells, etc. overriding the default item configuration.
hints.preventActionRollOnWarning: Prevent users from rolling if a validation warning is present.
hints.protectRolls: When enabled, players will be unable to see roll formulae for any rolls made by actors they do not have at least observer permissions for. The DCs of any saving throws will also be hidden from them
hints.randomizeNPCHitPoints: When enabled, the hit points of NPCs with be randomly rolled based on their hit point formula when an actor is dragged to a scene.
hints.removeActiveEffectsOnLongRest: When enabled, all onUse active effects will be removed from the actor when a long rest is taken.
hints.replaceFatigueAndStrife: When enabled, the Fatigue and Strife conditions will be replaced with the Exhaustion condition.
hints.reverseAltBehavior: By default, holding the left alt key will skip the roll dialog for rolls. If this setting is checked, the roll dialog will be skipped unless the alt key is held when clicking the roll button.
hints.reverseInitiativeAltBehavior: By default, holding the left alt key will skip the roll dialog for initiative rolls. If this setting is checked, the initiative roll dialog will be skipped unless the alt key is held when clicking the roll button. Note this settings is affected by the 'Reverse Alt Behavior' setting. If the 'Reverse Alt Behavior' setting is enabled, this setting will flip the alt behavior of initiative rolls.
hints.showDescriptionOnLimitedPerms: Show description on items when items have limited permissions. This will respect the identified state of the item.
hints.showEffectsPanel: The effects panel shows a summary of the conditions and temporary effects for the selected token. You can find these icons on the right side of the screen, left of the chat window.
hints.showFavorPoints: When enabled, Favor Points will be added to actors and as a resource.
hints.simpleInitiative: When enabled, initiative rolls will take the form of a simple ability check.
hints.simpleRests: When enabled, long rests will automatically recover a level of Fatigue, Strife, and Exhaustion as applicable, and users will not be prompted as to whether they rested in a haven or consumed supply.
hints.skillListFlowDirection: Setting this option to 'Row' causes the skills to flow alphabetically left to right, row by row. Setting this option 'Column' causes the skills to flow alphabetically top to bottom, column by column.
hints.terseRollFormulae: The system provides detailed roll annotations in chat card roll formulae. Enabling this setting removes all roll annotations in this formula display, providing a cleaner aesthetic at the expense of clarity.
hints.trackCurrencyWeight: Each coin will add 0.02lbs to the weight being carried.
hints.useNPCExpertisePassiveRulesForCharacters: When enabled, characters will use the NPC expertise passive rules for skills.
hints.usePoSTables: When enabled, critical skill successes and failures will roll on the Paradigms of Skill roll tables, instead of the standard Level Up tables.

A5E.settings.title: System Settings
A5E.settings.reload: This operation will refresh the page.
A5E.settings.autoApplyFancySheets: Automatically Apply Fancy Sheets to Compendia
A5E.settings.visionRulesApplyToCharactersOnly: Apply Vision Automation to Characters Only
A5E.settings.collapseActionList: Hide action list in locked mode
A5E.settings.critDoubleDiceQuantityAndMods: Double dice quantity and double modifiers
A5E.settings.critMaxDamagePlusRoll: Maximize dice damage and roll a second set
A5E.settings.hideRandomizedHPRolls: Hide NPC randomized hit point rolls
A5E.settings.includeAbilityModifiersForSkills: Include ability modifiers in skill modifiers
A5E.settings.removeActiveEffectsOnLongRest: Remove active effects on long rest
A5E.settings.replaceFatigueAndStrife: Replace Fatigue and Strife with Exhaustion
A5E.settings.restoreSpellPointsOnShortRest: Restore spell points on a short rest
A5E.settings.restoreSpellSlotsOnShortRest: Restore spell slots on a short rest
A5E.settings.reverseAltBehavior: Reverse alt behavior for all rolls
A5E.settings.showDescriptionOnLimitedPerms: Show description when ownership is limited
A5E.settings.useNPCExpertisePassiveRulesForCharacters: Use NPC expertise passive rules for characters
A5E.settings.usePoSTables: Use Paradigms of Skill Critical Tables

checks.defaultSelection: Select Skill Check Source Automatically in Roll Prompt
checks.title: Skill Check

hints.1: • You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
hints.2:
• You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
  • You suffer a –2 penalty to Strength checks, but have advantage on checks made to escape the grappled or restrained conditions.
hints.3:
• You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
  • You suffer a –2 penalty to Strength checks, but have advantage on checks made to escape the grappled or restrained conditions.
  • You must rest for a full 12 hours to achieve the benefits of a long rest (a regular 8-hour rest only counts as a short rest for you). However, you have advantage on either your first attack roll , ability check , or saving throw of the day.
hints.4:
• You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
  • You suffer a –2 penalty to Strength checks, but have advantage on checks made to escape the grappled or restrained conditions.
  • You must rest for a full 12 hours to achieve the benefits of a long rest (a regular 8-hour rest only counts as a short rest for you). However, you have advantage on either your first attack roll , ability check , or saving throw of the day.
  • You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws. Any time you are hit with a melee weapon attack, the attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC or take 2d4 acid damage. Any creature who consumes your blood (such as a vampire) automatically takes 4d4 acid damage.
hints.5:
• You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
  • You suffer a –2 penalty to Strength checks, but have advantage on checks made to escape the grappled or restrained conditions.
  • You must rest for a full 12 hours to achieve the benefits of a long rest (a regular 8-hour rest only counts as a short rest for you). However, you have advantage on either your first attack roll , ability check , or saving throw of the day.
  • You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws. Any time you are hit with a melee weapon attack, the attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC or take 2d4 acid damage. Any creature who consumes your blood (such as a vampire) automatically takes 4d4 acid damage.
  • You have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws . Any creature who attempts to read your mind (as in the spell detect thoughts) must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 12) or take 2d6 psychic damage.
hints.6:
• You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
  • You suffer a –2 penalty to Strength checks, but have advantage on checks made to escape the grappled or restrained conditions.
  • You must rest for a full 12 hours to achieve the benefits of a long rest (a regular 8-hour rest only counts as a short rest for you). However, you have advantage on either your first attack roll , ability check , or saving throw of the day.
  • You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws. Any time you are hit with a melee weapon attack, the attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC or take 2d4 acid damage. Any creature who consumes your blood (such as a vampire) automatically takes 4d4 acid damage.
  • You have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws . Any creature who attempts to read your mind (as in the spell detect thoughts) must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 12) or take 2d6 psychic damage.
  • Your Charisma score is reduced by 2, but you gain immunity to poison and necrotic damage.
hints.7:
• You lose one skill, tool, or language proficiency gained from your background of the Narrator’s choosing. That proficiency is replaced with a different proficiency of the same type (a skill is replaced with a skill, a language with a language, etc.).
  • You suffer a –2 penalty to Strength checks, but have advantage on checks made to escape the grappled or restrained conditions.
  • You must rest for a full 12 hours to achieve the benefits of a long rest (a regular 8-hour rest only counts as a short rest for you). However, you have advantage on either your first attack roll , ability check , or saving throw of the day.
  • You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws. Any time you are hit with a melee weapon attack, the attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC or take 2d4 acid damage. Any creature who consumes your blood (such as a vampire) automatically takes 4d4 acid damage.
  • You have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws . Any creature who attempts to read your mind (as in the spell detect thoughts) must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 12) or take 2d6 psychic damage.
  • Your Charisma score is reduced by 2, but you gain immunity to poison and necrotic damage.
  • You radiate an Evil aura, and good-aligned creatures (such as a solar or other celestial) react to your presence with hostility. Any time you attempt to enter a hallowed place dedicated to a good-aligned force, you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 15). On a failure, you cannot enter the area for 1d4 days, after which you may repeat the saving throw. However, you learn the vampiric touch spell. You can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. When you cast it in this way, the spell is considered to have been cast using a 5th-level spell slot.

hints.1: • Buzzed (DC 10) You feel pleasantly warm, and your inhibitions are lifted slightly. So long as you remain in the building or area where you are carousing, you gain an expertise die to checks to make friends with the locals or learn information.
hints.2:
• Tipsy (DC 12) You feel pleasantly warm, and your inhibitions are lifted slightly. So long as you remain in the building or area where you are carousing, you gain an expertise die to checks to make friends with the locals or learn information.
  • While you may be good at making friends, you’re not so great at keeping secrets. You have disadvantage on Deception checks made to conceal information or your intentions.
hints.3:
• Drunk (DC 14) You feel pleasantly warm, and your inhibitions are lifted slightly. So long as you remain in the building or area where you are carousing, you gain an expertise die to checks to make friends with the locals or learn information.
  • While you may be good at making friends, you’re not so great at keeping secrets. You have disadvantage on Deception checks made to conceal information or your intentions.
  • Even the most dexterous individuals start losing some of their edge after a few drinks. You gain a –2 penalty to your Dexterity score. Despite this, you still try to perform feats of dexterity to show off.
hints.4:
• Slurred (DC 16) You feel pleasantly warm, and your inhibitions are lifted slightly. So long as you remain in the building or area where you are carousing, you gain an expertise die to checks to make friends with the locals or learn information.
  • While you may be good at making friends, you’re not so great at keeping secrets. You have disadvantage on Deception checks made to conceal information or your intentions.
  • Even the most dexterous individuals start losing some of their edge after a few drinks. You gain a –2 penalty to your Dexterity score. Despite this, you still try to perform feats of dexterity to show off.
  • Your speech becomes slurred and difficult to understand. You have disadvantage on all Charisma-based checks.
hints.5:
• Sloppy (DC 18) You feel pleasantly warm, and your inhibitions are lifted slightly. So long as you remain in the building or area where you are carousing, you gain an expertise die to checks to make friends with the locals or learn information.
  • While you may be good at making friends, you’re not so great at keeping secrets. You have disadvantage on Deception checks made to conceal information or your intentions.
  • Even the most dexterous individuals start losing some of their edge after a few drinks. You gain a –2 penalty to your Dexterity score. Despite this, you still try to perform feats of dexterity to show off.
  • Your speech becomes slurred and difficult to understand. You have disadvantage on all Charisma-based checks.
  • You’ve gone just a little too far, and you’re probably going to feel this in the morning. You must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw to move your normal Speed. If an ally is assisting you, roll the save at advantage.

  • Disadvantage on concentration checks
  • Can only take a bonus action or action each turn (not both)
  • Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws using Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma
  • Suffer the effects of a randomly determined short-term mental stress effect.
  • Cannot cast spells (but can cast cantrips)
hints.7:
• Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks
  • Disadvantage on concentration checks
  • Can only take a bonus action or action each turn (not both)
  • Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws using Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma
  • Suffer the effects of a randomly determined short-term mental stress effect.
  • Cannot cast spells (but can cast cantrips)
  • Suffer the effects of a randomly determined long-term mental stress effect.

warnings.modifiedByEffect: Cannot edit properties that are being modified by an active effect.
